value.title: Use DAX in Power BI Desktop to solve business problems
value.excerpt: In this module, youâ€™ll solve three different business problems by optimizing the data model and creating Data Analysis Expressions (DAX) calculations.

value.title: Use DAX time intelligence functions in Power BI Desktop models
value.excerpt: By the end of this module, you'll learn the meaning of time intelligence and how to add time intelligence DAX calculations to your model. These calculations will include year-to-date (YTD), year-over-year (YoY) growth, and others.

value.title: #3 Dax Fridays! 101:  5 things i wish somebody told me when I started learning DAX

value.title: DAX Fridays! #14: SUMMARIZE
value.excerpt: Learn how to use the function SUMMARIZE in DAX/ Powerpivot.  The function SUMMARIZE can return a summary of sales grouped around the calendar year and the product category name, this result table allows you to do analysis over the reseller sales by year and product category.  Source:https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/gg492171.aspx

value.title: DAX Fridays! #166: Compare spread after the first 100 cases | Recreating the Financial Times Graph
value.excerpt: In todays video I will show you how to recreate the financial times graph in power bi where they compare the spread of confirmed cases after the countries hit their first 100 cases.  We will do the calculation using DAX and will plot the graph in Power BI.  Link to FT article: https://www.ft.com/content/a26fbf7e-48f8-11ea-aeb3-955839e06441

value.title: DAX Fridays! #183: How to deal with multiple dates in Power BI
value.excerpt: So you have order date, shipped date, required date....and only one calendar. How do you manage that in power bi and DAX? value.title: DAX Fridays! #23: ISFILTERED
value.excerpt: In this video we will through the ISFILTERED function in DAX.  This function is useful to detect when a column has been filtered and as shown in this video you can use it to set conditions when a column has been filtered.
